sub_title: Owner of Sako juwelier, owner of vintagejewellery.com, sparkleamsterdam.com and oudgoud.nl
summary:
I am a new woman with extensive experience in the field:
-Wine development market
-Purchasing
-Order processing
- Invoicing 
- Customer contact
- Maintenance of master data
- Experience in using IT programs such as Word, Excel, Visma and Navision
- Simple bookkeeping work

I am conscientious and responsible and able to work independently. I am keen to take on new tasks and learn new things easily.

I value a good working environment and like to create a good atmosphere among my colleagues.

During the last years I studied Logistics and Supply Chain Management, both of which are part of the curriculum of the International School of Transportation and Logistics, as I would like to be able to work professionally in these areas in the future to better utilize the wine market.

Additionally, I took the SAP Foundation Program I+II in the spring of 2015.

I have also worked with a variety of financial management and order processing programs in my position in the wine field, so I am used to familiarizing myself with new systems.

My spare time is mainly spent on fitness, traveling, house and garden. In addition, I follow American football on a regular basis and was once a flag football player and referee in college.

school.name: Department of Computer Science (D-INFK), ETH Zürich

profile_positions.title: Head of Human Resources

profile_positions.description:
Promoted to Head of Client Relations to oversee the strategic, plans and service performance of the client relations department while boosting recruitment and operational impact 
 Successfully boosted profitability by 75% through a transformation of talent investment that reduced employee turnover and safeguarded key talent through a challenging corporate reorganisation
 Achieved further improvements in employee satisfaction post-reorganisation to 91% which also boosted productivity by 29% and decreased agency usage by 38% 
 Steered the rollout of the Work From Home policy initially at the start of the Covid-19 pandemic, which following success, was integrated as a permanent option for the entire business 
 Analysed the commercial value of 10+ new CRM systems, selected a preferred option and pitched to the Board of Directors to secure funding to steer a significant CRM-based upgrade to IT services 
 Passionately heads up the complaint’s aspects of the business. Took the lead on high-level complaints, problem resolution and advocacy to ensure good outcomes from complaint activities. Further accountable for the reduction of complaints in line with FCA and FOS best practices and liaison with FCA/FOS representatives 
 Planned and executed talent acquisition campaigns that resulted in an increase in candidate calibre and the introduction of new talent into the client relations, security, and wealth operations team
 Owns the client journey from initial contact to quotation, sales, and onboarding, with a particular focus on the growth of client relationships and accounts that safeguards revenue generation internally 
 Sustains a personal reputation as an Expert on Client Relations for Finance, including as an FCA Fit & Proper person and main contact that ensures client activities remain compliant
profile_positions.title: Team Lead Manager

profile_positions.description:
(Dr. Loosen) is a winery with a history of more than 200 years and has always been run by the same family. In 1988, Mr. Ernst Loosen took over the winery. Although Mr. Loosen had no experience in winemaking, before taking over the winery he had studied at various famous wineries around the world and realized that soil, climate and grapes were essential to make good wine. He then rebuilt the winery with his faithful comrade Bernhard Schug and took it to a new level. Using the old, ungrafted vines planted at the winery, they have produced a more nuanced and fresh white wine than ever before. In order to make great wine, Mr. Roussen reduced the acreage, farmed only with organic fertilizers, and minimized disturbances to the wine during the winemaking process.

　　Only Riesling grapes are planted in the vineyards of Chateau Roussen, which have plots in famous vineyards such as the Corona in Mosel. At harvest time, the vineyards are inspected daily to determine the timing of the harvesting of the grapes in the different vineyards. After the harvest, the grapes from the different vineyards are vinified separately. As a result, the quality of the single-vineyard wines is high. Among the estate's plots, the Sundial (Sonnenuhr) is known for its elegant and complex wines. The thin, blue slate soils give the wines a minerality, and their fresh acidity and white peach and lemon aromas blend together in a well-balanced wine. The Sundial is best known for its late-picked wines, and Parker rated its 2004 vintage 90 points.
